title: loop
name: loop
description:
Looping is a very powerful programming technique that lets you repeat a set of instructions or
  display output repeatedly until one or more conditions are met. cfloop supports five types of loops.

attributes.name: index
attributes.description: Index value. Lucee sets it to from value and increments or decrements by step value, until it equals to value.

attributes.name: from
attributes.description: Beginning value of index.

attributes.name: to
attributes.description: Ending value of index.

attributes.name: step
attributes.description: Step by which to increment or decrement the index value.

attributes.name: condition
attributes.description: Condition that controls the loop.

attributes.name: query
attributes.description: Query that controls the loop. this can be a variable name or the query itself.

attributes.name: startRow
attributes.description: First row of query that is included in the loop.

attributes.name: endRow
attributes.description: Last row of query that is included in the loop. You cannot use this attribute together with the attribute maxRows.

attributes.name: maxRows
attributes.description: Specifies the maximum number of rows to display in the output section. You cannot use this attribute together with the attribute endrow.

attributes.name: list
attributes.description: A list, variable, or file name; contains a list

attributes.name: array
attributes.description: An array.

attributes.name: delimiters
attributes.description: Character(s) that separates items in list

attributes.name: collection
attributes.description: Collection to loop over

attributes.name: struct
attributes.description: struct to loop over

attributes.name: item
attributes.description: Key for the collection

attributes.name: file
attributes.description: file path

attributes.name: characters
attributes.description:
The number of characters to read during each iteration of the loop from the file specified in the file attribute.
If the value of the characters attribute is more than the number of characters in the file,
Lucee uses the number of characters in the file.

attributes.name: startline
attributes.description: start line

attributes.name: endline
attributes.description: end line

attributes.name: charset
attributes.description: charset for read the file

attributes.name: group
attributes.description:
Specifies the query column to use when you group sets of records together to send as an e-mail
		message. For example, if you send a set of billing statements to customers, you might group on
		"Customer_ID." The group attribute, which is case sensitive, eliminates adjacent duplicates when the
		data is sorted by the specified field. See the Usage section for exceptions.

attributes.name: groupCaseSensitive
attributes.description:
Boolean indicating whether to group with regard to case or not. The default value is NO;
		case is considered while grouping. If the query attribute specifies a query object that was generated
		by a case-insensitive SQL query, set the groupCaseSensitive attribute to NO to keep the recordset
		intact.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: used to a address this loop from a "break" or "continue" statement (instead of the nearest one).

attributes.name: times
attributes.description: used for a simple loop that is looping n times
